summary: Parent workflow was incorrectly waiting for child workflow completion when using POLICY_ABANDON parent close policy. The parent should only wait for the child to start, then complete independently while the child continues execution.
userImpact: Users cannot spawn child workflows with abandon policy and have parent workflows complete independently, preventing asynchronous child workflow patterns.
rootCause: The SDK implementation was blocking parent workflow completion until child workflow finished, contrary to the abandon parent close policy specification.
proposedFix: Fix the SDK to allow parent workflow to complete once child workflow has started (ChildWorkflowExecutionStarted event appears), rather than waiting for full child completion.
workaround: Use an activity with injected workflow client to spawn workflows from within activities instead of direct child workflow calls.
resolutionDetails: Bug was fixed in a subsequent release (mentioned in PR #167). Users need to update to latest SDK version where parent only waits for child to start.
keyQuote: The parent only waits for child to start. Once the child is started, the parent (with abandon policy) can be completed.
